intro: Durabaculum amboinense, commonly known as the Amboina durabaculum, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
